intro: Diplotaxis tenuisiliqua, commonly known as narrow-leaved diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
